data.title: atom 1.8 stable symbol error
data.body:
With atom 1.8 on fedora 22 when i type the letter "e" i get the euro symbol "€" ..
This is not an issue with atom 1.6 which i'm currently using.

data.title: 'ebase-merge' is not recognized...' when doing interactive rebase with atom
data.body:
### Description

When I try to do an interactive rebase with atom, atom screen doesn't show up and error message is shown (see actual behavior). [This](http://stackoverflow.com/questions/37573298/git-rebase-fails-with-ebase-merge-is-not-recognized) is the only link I could find relevant to the issue. If I unset atom as core editor, I can successfully rebase with vim. @lee-dohm 
### Steps to Reproduce (approximately)
1. [Install git & atom, clone a repo, make atom core editor]
2. exact command I used was `git rebase -i origin/master~3 master`

**Expected behavior:** atom to open

**Actual behavior:** error message is shown:

```
'ebase-merge' is not recognized as an internal or external command,
operable program or batch file.
```
### Versions

atom 1.8.0
apm  1.9.2
npm  2.13.3
node 0.10.40
python 2.7.11
git 2.9.0.windows.1
visual studio 2013

data.title: :memo: Mention how models must implement getTitle() [ci skip]

data.title: Don't erase NODE_ENV from environment.
data.body:
Atom sets NODE_ENV to 'production' earlier, but some code paths can cause it to be un-set. This degrades performance and sometimes crashes React. Fixes #12024.

I've tested this on Linux and macOS, but not Windows.

data.title: *Atom 1.8.0* Still not able to use Atom as commit message editor.
data.body:
After adding atom as commit editor using: 

git config --global core.editor "'C:\Users\Eivind\AppData\Local\atom\app-1.8.0\atom' -n -w"

When trying to commit (with a running instance of atom) I get the message 
"Aborting commit due to empty commit message.".
Atom still opens a new window for me to write a commit message, but doesn't wait.
It does work properly when atom is not running. But it's a pain having to close it for every commit.

This is the same problem as issue: #3074
(I thought this was resolved?)

EDIT:
If I open atom from git bash using "atom &" it will not let me use the command line, even if I close atom, I have to use "CTRL+C" to interrupt the command line and make it available again. If i open atom without "&", and then close atom, the command line becomes available as expected.

Versions:
Atom    : 1.8.0
Electron: 0.36.8
Chrome  : 47.0.2526.110
Node    : 5.1.1

apm  1.9.2
npm  2.13.3
node 0.10.40
python
git 2.9.0.windows.1
visual studio

OS: Win10 x64
*Using git bash

PS: I am brand new to git and github, and programming on Win OS, sorry if I'm wasting your time with this and I'm just being stupid somehow.

data.title: Atom only opens one tab when clicking on files in tree view
data.body:
Ever since 1.0 Atom, when I open a file by clicking it in the project tree it opens a tab for that file. If I click a second file, it opens a new tab with the contents of the file (and thus I have two tabs, one for each file I've clicked on). 

In 1.80, this does not happen. If I click on a file it opens the contents of that file in a tab. If I click on a second file, the contents of that file appear in the same tab, closing the first file. 

Steps: 
1) Open a project with 2 or more editable files. 
2) click on a file to open it. It appears in a newly created tab. 
3) Click on another file. 

Actual - the contents of the second file  open in the very same tab, replacing the first file. The tab title changes too. 

Expected - A new, second, tab opens alongside the first tab and this continues whenever I click a file in the tree view. 

More info: Atom 1.80 on Mac OS X 10.11.5. I've already 1) replaced the .atom folder (renamed it and let Atom create a new one). Downloaded and replaces my copy of Atom. 

This is a pretty fundamental change in how I interact with files. For just two files I could create panes, but that's not feasible when I have a bunch of open files.

data.title: Running `atom` from the command line can un-set `process.env.NODE_DEV`, causing performance degradation & JS crashes
data.body:
Unless Atom is running in dev mode, it sets `process.env.NODE_ENV` to "production". (The relevant code is here: https://github.com/atom/atom/blob/a5fdf3e18a512349e7efb91b3c297b1a2b91bf63/src/initialize-application-window.coffee#L20) This improves the speed of React by disabling its debug mode.

But if Atom is already running, and already has `file.txt` open, and one runs `atom file.txt` from the command line, the command line's environment is used to overwrite Atom's current `process.env`. Most people don't have `NODE_DEV` set in their environment, so React falls back to its slow debug mode. 

The code responsible for "cloning" the environment is https://github.com/atom/atom/blob/a5fdf3e18a512349e7efb91b3c297b1a2b91bf63/src/environment-helpers.js#L75 Notice that it deletes the existing environment.

If React starts in production mode, it won't create some key debugging data structures. If it later changes to dev mode (because `process.env.NODE_DEV` becomes undefined), it will try to access those structures and crash.

This bug is responsible for several reported issues in packages that I maintain: https://github.com/Floobits/atom-term3/issues/63
https://github.com/Floobits/floobits-atom/issues/121

data.title: Got "gyp ERR" When Install Plugins After Update Linux Kernel
data.body:
I got an error when I install plugins for atom after compile and install Linux Kernel4.6.2

![ERROR](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/13065214/16252950/106d203c-3865-11e6-8234-8bbecd90f329.png)

I am using Atom 1.8.0 on Debian8. 
The way of compile and install Linux Kernel is [here](http://www.cyberciti.biz/faq/debian-ubuntu-building-installing-a-custom-linux-kernel/)
How to solve it?
Thanks!

data.title: Consider changing the TextEditor documentation
data.body: [The documentation](https://atom.io/docs/api/v1.8.0/TextEditor) for the TextEditor class includes a very mischievous example that has the effect of writing in all open TextEditors at the same time. Since this is unlikely to be the first thing a user wants to do with this class, and possibly results in some very tedious cleanup, the example should probably be changed so that the example selects only the active editor.

data.title: JavaScript API documentation is missing (at least) the notification options for buttons.
Task documentation duplicates Task::once
data.body:
### Description

The documentation of the `once()` method of `Task` is duplicated. Once as [`.once()`](https://atom.io/docs/api/v1.8.0/Task#once), and another time as [`::once()`](https://atom.io/docs/api/v1.8.0/Task#instance-once).

data.title: Unexpected behavior of tab length
data.body:
Atom 1.8.

If leaving the global tab length (i.e. in Core Settings, defaults to 2) empty. I can override its value in specific language packages and it works well.

If set the global tab length to some other value (say 4), I can set the specific language tab length to anything but 2. (The text placeholder says 'Default: 2', while I type in '2' it wipes it out and fills in 4 automatically). If I leave it empty the actual tab length follows the global settings (i.e. 4). By all means I can't set it to 2.

data.title: Fail to launch new window: SyntaxError: Unexpected end of input
data.body:
Was unable to start a 2nd editor window. The console showed this:


data.title: Question: Every click starts a selection even though I'm not holding the left button
data.body: Is this a feature of Atom?  I'm using Ubuntu and everything else appears fine.  Every time I left click (and release) it starts a new selection.  I have tried an alternate mouse, and restarting the editor.  It is really stuck.  I did want to write this incase it is a feature, in that case it needs a better way `out` ...

data.title: 'alt-d': 'native!' #doesn't work
data.body:
### Description

I set my keymap.cson to include 'alt-d': 'native!' because on my OSX keyboard, option-d is how I type "(". This gets a left paren, but it also deletes from the cursor to the end of the word.
### Steps to Reproduce
1. 'alt-d': 'native!' in keymap
2. go to middle of a word
3. press option-d (on a mac)
4. you get the native character to the left of the cursor as expected, but the rest of the word to the right of the cursor is deleted.

**Expected behavior:** [What you expected to happen]

**Actual behavior:** [What actually happened]
### Versions

1.8.0
1.9.0-beta0

data.title: [improvement] Decouple palette rendering from result gathering.
data.body:
This change becomes necessary when sifting through many results in the palette. For example, when pressing ctrl+p to open the file palette, typing something in is very laggy while Atom looks for matching files character by character.

To improve performance, we can decouple (run on separate ticks) rendering of the palette and result gathering (and possibly provide a loading animation while results are being gathered).

This will make typing always smooth regardless of how long it takes to load results.

Was the design of the palette meant to be synchronous? The only advantage I see for synchronous rendering is that typing and pressing enter will guarantee a certain result to exist by the time enter is pressed, while decoupling rendering will cause enter to possibly do nothing until enter is pressed when a result is present, and the present result might not be the exact result that the user intended. (This is how OS X's Spotlight Search palette works, the latter asynchronous form).

data.title: Typing enter before a closing bracket results in wrong indentation on new line
data.body:
See example:

![ss](https://www.dropbox.com/s/ydrj3pjiofafwec/wrong%20indentation%20with%20closing%20bracket.gif?dl=1)

When you press `enter` with the cursor positioned just before the closing bracket, the indentation of the new line is one unit off.

This is on Atom 1.10.0-dev-e5a3c9e, OS X 10.11.5.

data.title: "\%" as error in C code
data.body:
### Description

A `\%` string using in `format` of `printf`, `scanf`, etc, not show as special character. However, In code its is formatted as error (red backgroud using dark theme).
### Steps to Reproduce
1. Create new file;
2. select grammar for C
3. type `"\%"`

**Expected behavior:** I expected format as color of a special character, like `\0`

**Actual behavior:** The character is formatted as error, like when type `*/` without `/*`
### Versions

Atom    : 1.8.0
Electron: 0.36.8
Chrome  : 47.0.2526.110
Node    : 5.1.1
apm  1.9.2
npm  2.13.3
node 0.10.40
python 2.7.11+
git 2.7.4
Distributor ID: Ubuntu
Description:    Ubuntu 16.04 LTS
Release:    16.04
Codename:   xenial

data.title: Add line-height to tips to fix appearance on line-breaks
Recreate Repository if the same project is added after being removed
data.body:
Previously promises resolving to destroyed repositories remained in our cache after removing a project folder. This caused subsequent calls to `repositoryForDirectory` to return the previous instance of the `GitRepository`, even after adding the working directory back to the project.

/cc: @atom/core

data.title: Control + S most of the time scrolls to the bottom of file
data.body:
### Prerequisites
- [x] Can you reproduce the problem in [safe mode](http://flight-manual.atom.io/hacking-atom/sections/debugging/#check-if-the-problem-shows-up-in-safe-mode)?
- [x] Are you running the [latest version of Atom](http://flight-manual.atom.io/hacking-atom/sections/debugging/#update-to-the-latest-version)?
- [x] Did you check the [debugging guide](http://flight-manual.atom.io/hacking-atom/sections/debugging/)?
- [x] Did you check the [FAQs on Discuss](https://discuss.atom.io/c/faq)?
- [x] Are you reporting to the [correct repository](https://github.com/atom/atom/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#atom-and-packages)?
- [x] Did you [perform a cursory search](https://github.com/issues?q=is%3Aissue+user%3Aatom+-repo%3Aatom%2Felectron) to see if your bug or enhancement is already reported?

For more information on how to write a good [bug report](https://github.com/atom/atom/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#how-do-i-submit-a-good-bug-report) or [enhancement request](https://github.com/atom/atom/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#how-do-i-submit-a-good-enhancement-suggestion), see the `CONTRIBUTING` guide.
### Description

When I save a file using CTRL + S, for some reason it most of the time scrolls to the bottom of any file I'm working on. It doesn't do it 100% of the time, but enough to get annoying.
### Steps to Reproduce
1. Use CTRL + S

**Expected behavior:** Saves current file am working on.

**Actual behavior:** Saves the file currently working on, with sometimes scrolling to the very bottom of the file. 
### Versions

1.8.0
Windows 10

data.title: 🐛 Fix $NODE_PATH being unset when using -a to add project
data.body: When the -a flag is used, atom replaces env of the existing window. Since this existing window doesn't rerun `init-application-window.coffee`, the $NODE_PATH env variable becomes unset. This commit moves setting $NODE_PATH earlier in the window creation process so that it gets set regardless. This fixes the [issue](https://github.com/atom/fuzzy-finder/issues/205) where fuzzy-finder's indexing task cannot find the 'atom' module because the $NODE_PATH becomes unset.

data.title: Can't type national characters in atom due to default keybindings
data.body:
I really love atom, but I can't get past default keybindings on some keyboard combinations. 

For example:

```
"alt-o" should make "ó", but it opens folder menu
"alt-z" should make "ż", but it doesn't work

```

I tried to bypass this using keymap file:

```
'.workspace .editor':
  'ctrl-alt-o': 'unset!'
  'ctrl-alt-z': 'unset!'

```

But it doesn't work. How can I fix it?
